comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: This may be "Belmont", a house that once stood on the site of the Clifton Terrace / Wardman Court apartments (1312 Clifton St., NW) in Columbia Heights: A few elements are obviously missing, but I wonder if this photo wasn't actually taken a bit earlier than the date given in the description. Construction on Belmont finished in 1886 - maybe this was taken while work was still under way? Other images of the house are available on pg. 116-117 of James Goode's Capital Losses (2nd ed.).

comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: Looking more closely at this image, I'm fairly convinced it's Belmont - I can't find any information RE: when the porch visible in the 2nd image was added, though. D.C. historian Paul K. Williams reports here that: Around the turn of the Century, Belmont Street seemed to attract many members of the geological, naturalist, and early environmental professions, most of whom worked at the Smithsonian Institution ... So Smillie may well have been in the neighborhood.
